item.text: Then he began to speak to them in parables: “A man planted a vineyard. He put a fence around it, dug a pit for its winepress, and built a watchtower. Then he leased it to tenant farmers and went on a journey.

At harvest <st data-num="2540" class="">time</st> he <st data-num="649" class="">sent</st> a <st data-num="1401" class="">slave</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="4314" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="1092" class="">tenants</st> <st data-num="2443">to</st> <st data-num="2983" class="">collect</st> <st data-num="3844">from</st> <st data-num="1092" class="">them</st><n id="2" /> his <st data-num="2590" class="">portion</st> of the <st data-num="290" class="">crop</st>.<n id="3" />

<st data-num="2532" class="">But</st><n id="1" /> those tenants<n id="2" /> <st data-num="2983" class="">seized</st> his <st data-num="846" class="">slave</st>,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="1194" class="">beat</st> him,<n id="4" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="649" class="">sent</st> him <st data-num="649">away</st> <st data-num="2756" class="">empty-handed</st>.<n id="5" />

<st data-num="2532" class="">So</st><n id="1" /> he <st data-num="649" class="">sent</st> <st data-num="243" class="">another</st> <st data-num="1401" class="">slave</st> <st data-num="4314" class="">to</st> <st data-num="846" class="">them</st> <st data-num="3825" class="">again</st>. <st data-num="2548">This one</st> they <st data-num="2775">struck on the head</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="818">treated outrageously</st>.

He <st data-num="649" class="">sent</st> <st data-num="243" class="">another</st>, <st data-num="2548">and that one</st> they <st data-num="615" class="">killed</st>. This happened to <st data-num="4183" class="">many</st> <st data-num="243">others</st>, <st data-num="3303" class="">some</st> of <st data-num="3739" class="">whom</st> were <st data-num="1194" class="">beaten</st>, <st data-num="3739" class="">others</st> <st data-num="615" class="">killed</st>.

He <st data-num="2192" class="">had</st> <st data-num="1520" class="">one</st> <st data-num="2089">left</st>, his one <st data-num="27" class="">dear</st> <st data-num="5207" class="">son</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="2078" class="">Finally</st> he <st data-num="649" class="">sent</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> <st data-num="4314" class="">to</st> <st data-num="846" class="">them</st>, <st data-num="3004" class="">saying</st>, ‘They will <st data-num="1788" class="">respect</st> <st data-num="1473" class="">my</st> <st data-num="5207" class="">son.’</st>

<st data-num="1161" class="">But</st> <st data-num="1565" class="">those</st> <st data-num="1092" class="">tenants</st> <st data-num="3004" class="">said</st> <st data-num="4314" class="">to</st> <st data-num="1438">one another</st>, ‘<st data-num="3778">This</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st> the <st data-num="2818" class="">heir</st>. <st data-num="1205" class="">Come</st>, let’s <st data-num="615" class="">kill</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="2817" class="">inheritance</st> will <st data-num="1510" class="">be</st> <st data-num="1473" class="">ours!’</st>

<st data-num="2532" class="">So</st><n id="1" /> they <st data-num="2983" class="">seized</st> him,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="615" class="">killed</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1544" class="">threw</st> <st data-num="846" class="">his body</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="1854">out of</st> the <st data-num="290" class="">vineyard</st>.<n id="4" />

<st data-num="5101" class="">What</st> <st data-num="3767">then</st> will the <st data-num="2962" class="">owner</st> of the <st data-num="290" class="">vineyard</st> <st data-num="4160" class="">do</st>? He will <st data-num="2064" class="">come</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="622" class="">destroy</st><n id="1" /> those <st data-num="1092" class="">tenants</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1325" class="">give</st> the <st data-num="290" class="">vineyard</st> to <st data-num="243" class="">others</st>.<n id="2" />

Have you not read this scripture:

“‘The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone.
This is from the Lord, and it is marvelous in our eyes’?”
Now they wanted to arrest him (but they feared the crowd), because they realized that he told this parable against them. So they left him and went away.
Then they sent some of the Pharisees and Herodians to trap him with his own words.

When they <st data-num="2064" class="">came</st> they <st data-num="3004" class="">said</st> to <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>, “<st data-num="1320">Teacher</st>, we <st data-num="1492" class="">know</st> <st data-num="3754" class="">that</st> you <st data-num="1510" class="">are</st> <st data-num="227" class="">truthful</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> do <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="3199" class="">court</st> <st data-num="3762">anyone’s</st> favor <st data-num="1063" class="">because</st> you <st data-num="991" class="">show</st> no <st data-num="4383" class="">partiality</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="235" class="">but</st> <st data-num="1321" class="">teach</st> the <st data-num="3598" class="">way</st> of <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st> <st data-num="1909">in accordance with</st> the <st data-num="225" class="">truth</st>.<n id="2" /> Is it <st data-num="1832" class="">right</st><n id="3" /> to <st data-num="1325" class="">pay</st> <st data-num="2778" class="">taxes</st><n id="4" /> to <st data-num="2541" class="">Caesar</st><n id="5" /> <st data-num="2228" class="">or</st> <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st>? Should we <st data-num="1325" class="">pay</st> <st data-num="2228" class="">or</st> <st data-num="3361">shouldn’t</st> we?”

<st data-num="1161" class="">But</st> he <st data-num="1492" class="">saw</st> through <st data-num="846" class="">their</st> <st data-num="5272" class="">hypocrisy</st> and <st data-num="3004">said</st><n id="1" /> to <st data-num="846" class="">them</st>, “<st data-num="5101">Why</st> are you <st data-num="3985" class="">testing</st> <st data-num="1473" class="">me</st>? <st data-num="5342" class="">Bring</st> <st data-num="1473" class="">me</st> a <st data-num="1220" class="">denarius</st><n id="2" /> and let me <st data-num="1492">look at</st> it.”

<st data-num="1161" class="">So</st><n id="1" /> they <st data-num="5342" class="">brought</st> one, <st data-num="3004" class="">and</st> he <st data-num="3004" class="">said</st> to <st data-num="846" class="">them</st>, “<st data-num="5101">Whose</st> <st data-num="1504">image</st><n id="2" /> is <st data-num="3778" class="">this</st>, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> whose <st data-num="1923" class="">inscription</st>?” They <st data-num="3004" class="">replied</st>,<n id="3" /> “<st data-num="2541">Caesar’s</st>.”
Then Jesus said to them, “Give to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.” And they were utterly amazed at him.
Sadducees (who say there is no resurrection) also came to him and asked him,
“Teacher, Moses wrote for us: ‘If a man’s brother dies and leaves a wife but no children, that man must marry the widow and father children for his brother.’

There <st data-num="1510" class="">were</st> <st data-num="2033" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="80" class="">brothers</st>. The <st data-num="4413">first one</st> <st data-num="2983 1135">married</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> when he <st data-num="599" class="">died</st> he <st data-num="863" class="">had</st> <st data-num="3756" class="">no</st> <st data-num="4690" class="">children</st>.

The <st data-num="1208" class="">second</st> <st data-num="2983" class="">married</st> <st data-num="846" class="">her</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="599" class="">died</st> <st data-num="3361" class="">without</st> any <st data-num="4690" class="">children</st>, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="5615" class="">likewise</st> the <st data-num="5154" class="">third</st>.

<st data-num="3756" class="">None</st> of the <st data-num="2033" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="863" class="">had</st> <st data-num="4690" class="">children</st>. <st data-num="2078" class="">Finally</st>, the <st data-num="1135" class="">woman</st> <st data-num="599" class="">died</st> <st data-num="2532">too</st>.

<st data-num="1722" class="">In</st> the <st data-num="386" class="">resurrection</st>, <st data-num="3752">when</st> they <st data-num="450">rise</st> again,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="5101" class="">whose</st> <st data-num="1135" class="">wife</st> will she <st data-num="1510" class="">be</st>? <st data-num="1063" class="">For</st> all <st data-num="2033" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="2192" class="">had</st> <st data-num="1135" class="">married</st> <st data-num="846" class="">her</st>.”<n id="2" />

<st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus</st> <st data-num="5346" class="">said</st> to <st data-num="846" class="">them</st>, “<st data-num="3756">Aren’t</st> you <st data-num="4105" class="">deceived</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="1223" class="">for</st> <st data-num="3778">this reason</st> because you <st data-num="3361">don’t</st> <st data-num="1492" class="">know</st> the <st data-num="1124" class="">scriptures</st> <st data-num="3366" class="">or</st> the <st data-num="1411" class="">power</st> of <st data-num="2316" class="">God</st>?

<st data-num="1063" class="">For</st> <st data-num="3752" class="">when</st> they <st data-num="450" class="">rise</st> <st data-num="1537" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="3498" class="">dead</st>, they <st data-num="3777" class="">neither</st> <st data-num="1060" class="">marry</st> <st data-num="3777" class="">nor</st> are <st data-num="1061">given in marriage</st>, <st data-num="235" class="">but</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">are</st> <st data-num="5613" class="">like</st> <st data-num="32" class="">angels</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="1722" class="">in</st> <st data-num="3772" class="">heaven</st>.
Now as for the dead being raised, have you not read in the book of Moses, in the passage about the bush, how God said to him, ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’?
He is not the God of the dead but of the living. You are badly mistaken!”
Now one of the experts in the law came and heard them debating. When he saw that Jesus answered them well, he asked him, “Which commandment is the most important of all?”
Jesus answered, “The most important is: ‘Listen, Israel, the Lord our God, the Lord is one.
Love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your mind, and with all your strength.’
The second is: ‘Love your neighbor as yourself.’ There is no other commandment greater than these.”
The expert in the law said to him, “That is true, Teacher; you are right to say that he is one, and there is no one else besides him.
And to love him with all your heart, with all your mind, and with all your strength and to love your neighbor as yourself is more important than all burnt offerings and sacrifices.”
When Jesus saw that he had answered thoughtfully, he said to him, “You are not far from the kingdom of God.” Then no one dared any longer to question him.
While Jesus was teaching in the temple courts, he said, “How is it that the experts in the law say that the Christ is David’s son?

David himself, by the Holy Spirit, said,

“‘The Lord said to my lord,

“Sit at my right hand,

until I put your enemies under your feet.”’
If David himself calls him ‘Lord,’ how can he be his son?” And the large crowd was listening to him with delight.
In his teaching Jesus also said, “Watch out for the experts in the law. They like walking around in long robes and elaborate greetings in the marketplaces,

<st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="4410">best seats</st> <st data-num="1722" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="4864" class="">synagogues</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="4411">places of honor</st> <st data-num="1722" class="">at</st> <st data-num="1173" class="">banquets</st>.
They devour widows’ property, and as a show make long prayers. These men will receive a more severe punishment.”
Then he sat down opposite the offering box, and watched the crowd putting coins into it. Many rich people were throwing in large amounts.

<st data-num="2532" class="">And</st> <st data-num="3391">a</st> <st data-num="4434" class="">poor</st> <st data-num="5503" class="">widow</st> <st data-num="2064" class="">came</st> and <st data-num="906">put in</st> <st data-num="1417" class="">two</st> <st data-num="3016">small copper coins</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="1510">worth</st> <st data-num="2835">less than a penny</st>.

He <st data-num="4341" class="">called</st> <st data-num="846" class="">his</st> <st data-num="3101" class="">disciples</st> and <st data-num="3004" class="">said</st> to <st data-num="846" class="">them</st>, “I <st data-num="3004" class="">tell</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st> the <st data-num="281" class="">truth</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="3778" class="">this</st> <st data-num="4434" class="">poor</st> <st data-num="5503" class="">widow</st> has <st data-num="906" class="">put</st> <st data-num="4183">more</st> <st data-num="1519" class="">into</st> <st data-num="1049">the offering box</st><n id="2" /> than <st data-num="3956">all</st> the others.<n id="3" />
For they all gave out of their wealth. But she, out of her poverty, put in what she had to live on, everything she had.”
